verses.verse: I am the <S%H2261>rose<s%> of <S%H8289>Sharon<s%>, and the <S%H7799>lily<s%> of the <S%H6010>valleys<s%>.
As the <S%H7799>lily<s%> among <S%H2336>thorns<s%>, so is my <S%H7474>love<s%> among the <S%H1323>daughters<s%>.

As the apple <S%H8598>tree<s%> among the <S%H6086>trees<s%> of the <S%H3293>wood<s%>, so is my <S%H1730>beloved<s%> among the <S%H1121>sons<s%>. I <S%H3427>sat<s%> down under his <S%H6738>shadow<s%> with great <S%H2530>delight<s%>, and his <S%H6529>fruit<s%> was <S%H4966>sweet<s%> to my <S%H2441>taste<s%>.
He <S%H935>brought<s%> me to the <S%H3196>banqueting<s%> <S%H1004>house<s%>, and his <S%H1714>banner<s%> over me was <S%H160>love<s%>.
<S%H5564>Stay<s%> me with <S%H809>flagons<s%>, <S%H7502>comfort<s%> me with <S%H8598>apples<s%>: for I am <S%H2470>sick<s%> of <S%H160>love<s%>.
His left <S%H8040>hand<s%> is under my <S%H7218>head<s%>, and his right <S%H3225>hand<s%> does embrace <S%H2263>me<s%>.

I <S%H7650>charge<s%> <S%H1323>you<s%>, O you daughters of <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>, by the <S%H6643>roes<s%>, <S%H176>and<s%> by the <S%H355>hinds<s%> of the <S%H7704>field<s%>, that you stir not <S%H5782>up<s%>, nor <S%H5782>awake<s%> my <S%H160>love<s%>, until he <S%H2654>please<s%>.
The <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H1730>beloved<s%>! <S%H935>behold<s%>, he comes <S%H1801>leaping<s%> upon the <S%H2022>mountains<s%>, <S%H7092>skipping<s%> upon the <S%H1389>hills<s%>.

My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> is <S%H1819>like<s%> a <S%H6643>roe<s%> or a <S%H6082>young<s%> <S%H354>hart<s%>: <S%H5975>behold<s%>, he stands <S%H310>behind<s%> our <S%H3796>wall<s%>, he looks <S%H7688>forth<s%> at the <S%H2474>windows<s%>, <S%H6692>showing<s%> himself through the <S%H2762>lattice<s%>.
My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> <S%H6030>spoke<s%>, and <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H6965>me<s%>, Rise up, my <S%H7474>love<s%>, my fair <S%H3303>one<s%>, and come <S%H3212>away<s%>.
<S%H5638>For<s%>, behold, the winter is <S%H5674>past<s%>, the <S%H1653>rain<s%> is <S%H2498>over<s%> and <S%H1980>gone<s%>;

The <S%H5339>flowers<s%> <S%H7200>appear<s%> on the <S%H776>earth<s%>; the <S%H6256>time<s%> of the <S%H2158>singing<s%> of birds is <S%H5060>come<s%>, and the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the <S%H8449>turtle<s%> is <S%H8085>heard<s%> in our <S%H776>land<s%>;

The fig <S%H8384>tree<s%> puts <S%H2590>forth<s%> her green <S%H6291>figs<s%>, and the <S%H1612>vines<s%> with the tender <S%H5563>grape<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> a good <S%H7381>smell<s%>. <S%H6965>Arise<s%>, my <S%H7474>love<s%>, my fair <S%H3303>one<s%>, and come <S%H3212>away<s%>.

O my <S%H3123>dove<s%>, that are in the <S%H2288>clefts<s%> of the <S%H5553>rock<s%>, in the <S%H5643>secret<s%> places of the <S%H4095>stairs<s%>, let me <S%H7200>see<s%> your <S%H4758>favor<s%>, let me <S%H8085>hear<s%> your <S%H6963>voice<s%>; for <S%H6156>sweet<s%> is your <S%H6963>voice<s%>, and your <S%H4758>favor<s%> is <S%H5000>fitting<s%>.
<S%H270>Take<s%> us the <S%H7776>foxes<s%>, the <S%H6996>little<s%> <S%H7776>foxes<s%>, that <S%H2254>plunder<s%> the <S%H3754>vines<s%>: for our <S%H3754>vines<s%> have tender <S%H5563>grapes<s%>.
My <S%H1730>beloved<s%> is <S%H7462>mine<s%>, and I am his: he feeds among the <S%H7799>lilies<s%>.

Until the <S%H3117>day<s%> <S%H6315>break<s%>, and the <S%H6752>shadows<s%> flee <S%H5127>away<s%>, <S%H5437>turn<s%>, my <S%H1730>beloved<s%>, and be you <S%H1819>like<s%> a <S%H6643>roe<s%> or a <S%H6082>young<s%> <S%H354>hart<s%> upon the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> of <S%H1336>Bether<s%>.
